Description: Hello We have not received our Grocery to Go Order as of 230 pm It was supposed to be delivered by 200 pm Please advise If it is not coming a robo call needs to go out so all the seniors do not show up Christal Batey On Feb 12 2025 at 1105AM partner Support partnersupportcapitalareafoodbankorg wrote Good morning Partners We hope this message finds you well Today February 12th 2025 the Capital Area Food Bank is operating solely in an administrative capacity and there will be no deliveries or pickups due to the current weather conditions For partners who have orders scheduled for tomorrow or Friday we plan to operate under normal conditions However if you anticipate that your agency will be closed due to the weather please reach out to Customer Relations as soon as possible to discuss rescheduling your order at partnersupportcapitalareafoodbankorg or phone number Additionally even if your site remains open we require confirmation that your location has been safely plowed and salted to allow for safe deliveries If a driver arrives at your site and finds it is not adequately prepared please be aware that your agency may incur a restocking fee Our delivery equipment cannot navigate through snow or ice safely and we prioritize the safety of both our drivers and your staff We appreciate your cooperation and understanding as we work together to ensure everyones safety during this weather event We are actively monitoring the situation and will keep you updated with any changes regarding our operations for the rest of the week Thank you for your partnership Stay safe and warm Best regards Customer Relations

Comment:
06/13/2023 11:04;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good morning Zelda, 

I hope you are doing well. One of a few things could be happening. 

1.) If you are in editing mode, which means you clicked â€œEdit Orderâ€ and you are viewing your card- there will be error messages saying that there are zero availability because there is no more left of that item to add to your order. Whatever you had on your order before starting to edit the order is secured but the error message is saying that there is no more of this item available to add more of. 

2.) If you did not hit save, which I see that you said you did- then you could have lost of the items. Previously, the old system held in the carts for 24 hours, but that is no longer the case. 

3.) The last instance is that throughout the day, our warehouse team members are continuously doing quality checks. If for any reason produce fails that quality check or the warehouse team deems it as not being able to â€˜make itâ€™ (quality wise) to the date it's supposed to be delivered it can be taken off of your order. 

I am looking at your order and I do see eggplant, potatoes, cucumbers and squash on your orders. 

"D"
Comment.2: 06/13/2023 02:15;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;No problem, I apologize that that happened. I hope you enjoy the eggplant, potatoes, cucumbers and squash that are on your order!

Comment.5:
08/19/2024 02:44;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good afternoon,

Thank you for your question. Once you complete the checkout process, your items are put on a sales order and finalized. The emails you receive are due to potential errors in our inventory or the pulling process that may cause changes to your order before delivery.

This can happen for two main reasons. Firstly, if the pulling team finds that the item's quality is not up to our standards for delivery, it may be removed from your order or the quantity decreased. This can occur when partners place orders well in advance and by the time the order is picked, the item may no longer meet our quality standards.

Secondly, if we run out of a certain product, this could be due to periodic inventory errors where the actual count of items doesn't match what's on the menu.

While we strive to minimize these occurrences, we send email notifications to keep partners informed in case such changes are necessary before their order is fulfilled.

Thank you,

"D"
Comment.7: 08/20/2024 02:22;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;We are currently making enhancements to our systems to minimize occurrences such as this. However, unexpected events can occasionally disrupt our inventory. While we continue working on these significant improvements, in the meantime, we want to provide advance notice to our partners regarding any ordered items that may not be available. We appreciate your patience and understanding as we address this matter. Thank you.

Description: Dear Capital Area Food Bank Partner Support Team I hope this email finds you well I am writing on behalf of The Market at American University regarding our scheduled delivery on Monday January 6 between 122 pm SO189116 Due to a potential winter storm there is a possibility that the university might be closed on that day Could you please let us know what the process would be for rescheduling or managing the delivery if the university is closed We want to ensure were prepared and can coordinate appropriately Thank you for your guidance and support Best regards

Comment.1:
01/03/2025 12:51;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good afternoon,

Thank you for reaching out to us! We have an inclement weather policy that can be found on PartnerLink. Typically, when inclement weather is forecasted, we urge our partners to contact us in advance, before the Capital Area Food Bank makes a decision about whether we will be open for the day. This way, we can help reschedule orders to a later date if possible.

Please note that the Capital Area Food Bank does not follow government decisions regarding weather closures and delays. Our Operations Department and leadership team make decisions about our operating hours based on weather and road conditions to ensure the safety of our drivers and partners.

The earliest time I can schedule your order is January 13th. Please let me know if you would like to reschedule your order, and I can take care of it on our end.

Thank you again for reaching out!

Best regards,  
"D"

Description: Can you tell me the expiration dates on the donated items in my order There were many items without pictures so its difficult to know if they are appropriate for my site as well I dont know the weight or size of each item
Custom field (Request Category): Menu -> Product Best By / Expiration Date
Comment.1:
01/28/2025 12:09;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good afternoon,

Thank you for reaching out about the expiration dates on your product. Unfortunately, we cannot provide specific expiration dates for these items. When a product is labeled as "assorted," it means it is a compilation of dozens of different products under that category that have been donated. These items are sorted by our volunteer teams or donated in bulk. 

While our volunteers are instructed not to include expired foods, items that are past their "best by" or "sell by" dates are considered acceptable for consumption and may still be included. We encourage all partners receiving these donated cases to be aware of this and to use the Food Coding Guide created by our Food Resources team and Nutrition Department. Additionally, we recommend using your knowledge of food safety and your senses (sight, smell, and texture) to determine if the food is in good condition.

I apologize for not being able to provide further guidance on this matter. The nature of donated products, especially assorted bins, makes it difficult to pinpoint a specific expiration date for a mix of different items.

[^Food Coding Guidance.pdf]

Thank you,  
"D"

10/29/2024 03:50;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;_Hi Alanna- it will not allow me to remove you as the reporter of this ticket, do you mind passing this along? Thank you!_ 

Good afternoon,

Thank you for submitting this ticket to Customer Service. I have reviewed your reported issues and consulted with my colleagues in our Food Resources and Operations Teams.

Regarding the tortillas, I apologize that they were sent out after their expiration date. I have reported this to the Food Resources Team for further investigation. However, since you received them, I have processed a credit of $45.60 for the tortillas you ordered (which had a discount applied). This credit will be applied to the invoice associated with your order, Invoice #180569.

As for the flavored water, the date on the items indicated "BB," which stands for "best by." Many of our donated foods may be past their best by or sell by dates. These dates are intended to inform you of when the item is not at its peak quality, not about food safety. The items are still safe to consume, and we encourage our partners to use their judgment. If there are any signs of concernâ€”such as changes in taste, smell, or packagingâ€”do not distribute the item and please let us know.

[^Food Coding Guidance.pdf]

Thank you,

"D"

Description: Hello Of late I am not getting a phone call letting me know that the driver is on their way to our Pantry I enter a note for each of our orders asking that a driver call as they are leaving the warehouse so that our volunteers have enough time to get to our location when the truck arrives We are a small organization and our Pantry is just that a large closet that stores a tremendous amount of food We deliver our food to the clients so there is no office available for volunteers to wait When I scheduled todays delivery a morning slot was not available I had written asking if there would be any way to move our delivery up since we are normally an early delivery partner I was told that the delivery schedule was full for the morning so that I had to keep my noon 2 pm slot I happened to be at the Pantry to do some stocking and the truck arrived at 10 AM Luckily we were able to meet the driver with no delay to his schedule I would appreciate it if drivers could please view the special notesinstructions for each delivery I have been told by a few drivers that they do not see the special notes on their delivery receipt Thank you for your help Angela Harvey Pantry Manager Bethesda Help
Comment:
11/21/2024 12:05;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good afternoon, Angela,

  I hope this message finds you well. Thank you for your valuable feedback regarding our delivery process.  I will connect with our Transportation Team to clarify the issue and explore ways to improve it. Each morning, our Transportation Leadership prints out the day's sales orders, which should include the notes you and your team leave. I will double-check to ensure this process is still in place, as we established a notes section specifically for partners to provide important information for our drivers.  Additionally, I want to mention that there are times when drivers may finish their deliveries earlier than expected, or we may have more drivers available than anticipated. In such cases, drivers are instructed to call you to ask if you would like to receive your order before your scheduled delivery window. If you decline, they should wait until your designated delivery window.  I will reach out to confirm these details and will follow up with you. I understand that the current situation is not ideal and the implications it has on your distribution. 

Best regards,  

 "D"
Comment.1:
11/21/2024 02:24;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good afternoon, Angela, 

I just spoke with Joe, the Transportation Manager. He informed me that he discussed the delivery process and the expectation for courtesy calls with the driver who made your delivery yesterday, as well as the team of drivers during their morning meeting today. 

Joe confirmed that drivers should be able to see the notes you leave on your sales orders. More importantly, it is mandatory for them to call all partners before their deliveries, even if they are within the designated delivery window. This call is to inform you that they are on their way. In instances where drivers can make earlier deliveries, they must consult with you first to see if you can accommodate the earlier arrival; if not, they are expected to wait until the agreed delivery window.

If you continue to experience issues regarding this matter, please let me know, and I will arrange for Joe to give you a call to discuss it further.

Best,  
"D"

Comment.4:
11/19/2024 12:23;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good morning, Alanna, 

 I apologize for the delay in my response! I hope you are doing well. This is feedback that we have received across the regions and I have communicated it to the Operations Teams for their awareness. For now, please relay the message below to the partner: 

_Good afternoon- The Customer Relations Team has reported your concerns to our Senior Managers in Operations, and they are committed to helping our partners address these challenges. They will be reviewing options to improve the situation moving forward. For the time being, items will continue to be packed as they are currently, but the team is looking into alternatives that would make unpacking easier for you and other agencies.  I will keep you updated on any developments. I want to assure you that your feedback has been heard and is being taken into consideration.   The reason for the current packing method is due to truck capacity. If the pallets are not stacked, they will take up more space in the truck and could potentially require multiple trucks for delivery. Our drivers carry pallet jacks with them on their routes, but they do not have reach machines like those used in the warehouse to pull orders and unstack items.  We are working on this, and I apologize for the challenges it presents. Please reach out to patnersupport@capitalareafoodbank.orgwith with any concerns you may have._ 

 Best regards,  

 "D"

09/25/2024 09:15;712020:b15fa988-bc60-49b4-aa6f-e30b7a3629c1;Good morning,

Thank you for reaching out. We will not be hosting another training session, but there are tools available to assist you. You can find a guide in PDF format called "Hours of Operations" under the Partner Resource Tab on PartnerLink. This document provides instructions on how to update your hours of operation. 

Once you are logged into PartnerLink, click on your agency name to access your Account Overview. Under Additional Information, you will find a button labeled "Hours of Operations." Click on it to view the hours currently listed for your agency. If the hours are correct, click "verify" to confirm. If the hours are not correct, please make the necessary changes by clicking â€œeditâ€, submit them, and once approved by your Regional Coordinator, the updated hours will be officially updated.

If you still need assistance please attend one of our online Office Hours every Wednesday from 10am-10am: [https://capitalareafoodbank.zoom.us/zbook/partner-support/customer-relations-office-hours|https://capitalareafoodbank.zoom.us/zbook/partner-support/customer-relations-office-hours|smart-link]

Description: Good afternoon I wanted to follow up with you all regarding the issue with Capital Christian Fellowships produce hub earlier this week CCF adds food and edits the SO I make for their produce hubs In the past few months they have added thousands of pounds of food to these orders making them close to 40k pounds sometimes For the most recent hub order someone at CCF accidentally removed 3k pounds of produce meant for the produce hub Christ let me know that this can happen since the produce is marked as available for agencies and CAFB staff We are having a meeting tomorrow with CCF to discuss the produce hub orders I wanted to reach out to you all to get your insight on whether it would be beneficial for TransportationOps if I told CCF that they cannot addmodify produce hub SOs anymore However I wouldnt want CCF to create additional orders during the same time and further strain the capacity of TransportationOps If there is a specific pound limit that I should tell them not to exceed when adding food to the produce hub SOs I can do that as well I know that the produce limitations will impact their ordering so their order sizes will probably decrease in the next few months Please let me know if there is anything you would like me to mention during the meeting tomorrow Thank you again for all your help
Comment.1:
11/25/2024 02:37;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good afternoon, Grace,  

I hope you are doing well. I wanted to bring this matter to Austin and discuss it with her. I understand the implications of the large orders and the concerns surrounding the removal of produce for the produce hub. When I spoke to Austin, she suggested that the first step should be to have a conversation with the partner to explain the implications of their edits to the order. They need to be mindful that they donâ€™t want to lose their produce items meant for the hub and that they should be aware of the weight of their orders when placing them.  

Here are two key points I discussed with Austin:  

1. Currently, we do not have a formal limit for orders, so we cannot tell them what a limit would be. Operations and ERP/IT are working on measures to ensure that for large orders, the number of delivery blocks corresponds appropriately. For example, two weeks ago, Capital Christianâ€™s order required five trucks for delivery but only occupied one slot, which is unrealistic. For now, we can only ensure that Operations is aware and prepared for these situations.

 2. Austin mentioned that if this situation continues to cause recurring issues and impacts the produce hub's participating sitesâ€”resulting in a loss of produceâ€”we can consider locking their orders for the produce hubs and requesting that they create a separate order. However, this could complicate matters since Operations has asked us to consolidate orders for the same partner to avoid having one sales order versus two. We can explore this locking option as a last resort if recurring issues continue. 

 I hope this clarifies the situation, and please let me know if you need any assistance in engaging with the partner. 

 Best,  

 "D"

Comment.5:
08/21/2024 03:41;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good afternoon,

Thank you again for bringing up this question. I have spoken to our Operations Manager in the DC warehouse, and unfortunately, we are unable to unstack or repack the pallets of produce in a different manner due to the truck's space capacity and efficiency reasons. Packing the pallets differently would require sending multiple trucks, causing inefficiency, and we also do not have the bandwidth to unstack and unpackage the cases and pallets of produce for each partner participating in the produce hub. 

One suggestion is that your agency acquire a pallet jack during the next round of capacity grants to assist with this issue. I will also pass this feedback on to the Operations Leadership team for consideration, but currently, our Operations Team cannot accommodate it under our current operating procedures.

I apologize for this.

Thanks,

"D"

You can find a guide in PDF format called "Hours of Operations" under the Partner Resource Tab on PartnerLink. This document provides instructions on how to update your hours of operation.

Click on it to view the hours currently listed for your agency. If the hours are correct, click "verify" to confirm. If the hours are not correct, please make the necessary changes by clicking â€œeditâ€, submit them, and once approved by your Regional Coordinator, the updated hours will be officially updated.

08/28/2024 09:56;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good morning Godwin,

I hope this message finds you well. I am writing in response to your recent produce requests, particularly your most recent message. I want to assure you that we do receive all of your produce requests. As we've mentioned before, we can only add produce that is available.

Charity, the Customer Service Coordinator who has been assisting you, explained that we did not have any produce available on Monday. She assured you that she would monitor our inventory and add the produce to your order before it locks *if* it becomes available. Charity kept your ticket open and checked the menu regularly, but unfortunately, we did not have any produce to add to your order before it locked yesterday evening.

I understand your frustration with this process, but please know that the produce we receive is put on the menu as soon as it is available. While my team supports partners by monitoring the menu, it would be best for you to also check the menu for updates. Unfortunately, we cannot add produce that is simply not available.

I hope this provides some clarity. I also double-checked for any available produce before sending this message and saw that none was available.

Thank you,

"D"

Manager of Customer Relations and Distribution Network Evolution (DNE) Â

Description: We are by this mail request Capital Area Foodbank to include in our order for this month 100pcs of Turkey for Thanksgiving whenever it is available Our intention is to have our food give out on Saturday 23rd November 2024 by 12noon We thank you for your cooperation in this matter Regards Godwin Binutu For CCC Covenant Parish 2404678399
Comment:
11/06/2024 02:35;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good afternoon Godwin,

This year, our Food Procurement Team purchased two truckloads of turkeys, each at a cost of approximately $60 to $70 per case and were available on PartnerLink. These turkeys have been allocated to various orders and are no longer available.

I reached out to my colleagues on the Food Resources Team, who informed me that we often receive donated turkeys. These donations will be provided at no cost now that the shared maintenance fee has been waived for donated items. _However_, *we cannot predict if and when these donations will arrive*. Typically, individuals and organizations tend to donate turkeys closer to Thanksgiving, usually in the week before the holiday or during the holiday week itself. 

Please continue to check the menu regularly to see if turkeys are added. If we do receive them, they will be added to the menu and available to partners on a first-come, first-served basis.

Thank you,  
DH

Comment.3:
11/07/2024 01:26;60f1a20ea211b1006974e353;Hello Godwin,

Iâ€™m sorry to hear that you feel you havenâ€™t gotten the service you would like since there have been changes in staff. I would be happy to connect with you to discuss any challenges you are having. 

Regarding the turkeys, unfortunately, we donâ€™t have the capacity to track every partner that has received turkeys in the past, and it wouldnâ€™t be fair to our other partners to reserve inventory for a select few. However, there are times when we will receive a donation that is specifically allocated for the DC region. While this isnâ€™t a guarantee that we will receive such a donation, nor a promise to reserve anything, the regional team has made note of your interest and will notify you if we receive a special donation of turkeys for the region. As "D" mentioned, I also encourage you to continue checking PartnerLink so you will be aware as new items are added.

Please let me know if you have any further questions for the DC regional team. Thank you for your continued partnership and the work you are doing to serve our community.

Comment.1:
01/10/2025 02:52;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good afternoon,

Thank you for reaching out to us regarding the issues you encountered with your order. Our Return Policy, which is covered in our SMART Shopping Training, informs partners that any order discrepancies must be reported immediately. We provide partners with 24 hours for perishable items and 72 hours for non-perishable items to notify us about returns, exchanges, or any issues with their orders. We also encourage all partners to thoroughly review their orders upon delivery or pickup, so they can inform us about any discrepancies as soon as possible. I understand that circumstances, such as delivery day events, holidays, and our holiday and snow closures, can sometimes disrupt this process which can acount in the delay in notification.

Unfortunately, since the items you did not order have already been distributed and we are now beyond the timeframe for reporting discrepancies, the original account balance you paid for the order remains unchanged. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience this has caused your agency, especially regarding not receiving all the items you ordered. 

In the future, if you experience any issues like this, please contact my team, the Customer Relations Team, immediately via email at [partnersupport@capitalareafoodbank.org|mailto:partnersupport@capitalareafoodbank.org]. This will automatically create a ticket for my team. You can also reach us at our shared phone number 202-644-9845.

Thank you,

DH  
Manager of Customer Relations and Distribution Network Evolution

I am copying our food distribution team, and we will be sure to immediately report to your Customer Relations Team any discrepancies we may encounter in the future.

Kind regards,

Description: Hi Maria Thank you for reaching out about these issues with your order Im adding on this email so that they can decide how best to proceed Dont ever hesitate to reach out about incorrect orders even if its just a minor mistake We want to be sure our inventory is always correct so it helps to have partners let us know when weve made a mistake Thanks Joanna From Maria E Rodriguez Sent Wednesday November 13 2024 233 PM To Joanna Miller Subject Order SO182764 Hello Joanna I just came back from vacation yesterday and was looking over our inventory to compose our guidelines for this week and noticed that the chicken that we received on Friday was not the TEFAP chicken that we had ordered for pick up on 1108 Its on our team for not checking properly the case size and weight but the chicken which we received was the following 300595 Chicken Leg Quarters Halal 5 Chicken Leg Quarters Halal 5 65 lbs Bag We received 9 cases of the above chicken I knew it wasnt correct based on the count and the fact that it was halal I believe this is a purchase item through the CAFB website and wanted to check with you and the team to see how you would like to proceed As a side note on a past order we received 6 cases of TEFAP red kidney beans instead we had ordered 6 cases of TEFAP pears which was a minor problem and explained the importance of checking the order with our team prior to accepting The information contained in this communication from sent at 20241113 143359 is confidential and may be legally privileged It is intended solely for use by the intended recipient and others authorized to receive it If you have received this communication in error you are hereby notified that any disclosure copying distribution or taking action in reliance of the contents of this information is strictly prohibited and may be unlawful

Description: Does CAFB assist with grants for transportation for food pantries We are in need of a cargo van to transport food to our clients located in senior buildings and also to provide food on an emergency basis which requires transporting the food to the client If not able can you provide resources and grant opportunities that cover nonprofit organizations and transportation Thank you Janaclese Woods

Comment:
09/16/2024 12:18;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good afternoon Partner,

Thank you for your inquiry about Capacity Grants. We do indeed offer Capacity Grants at Capital Area Food Bank intended to help our partners expand their operations by providing financial assistance to cover the cost of items like storage or a vehicle. The Capacity Grant Application is embedded in our 2024 Fall Bi-Annual Survey, which will be released to partners in the second week of October. Please note that you will need to open and fill out the survey to access the Capacity Grant Application and then submit it. Once you submit your application, it will be reviewed by your Regional Team for consideration.

Thank you,

Customer Relations
Comment.1: 09/16/2024 12:19;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Please also reach out to your Regional Team Members to learn more about external grant opportunities that may be available for support.

07/03/2024 01:12;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good afternoon,

Thank you for contacting us about this issue. Unfortunately, there is a limit to the number of cases available for this item, and we are unable to provide more than 15 cases. If you have any further questions, please feel free to ask.

"D"

11/25/2024 02:12;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good morning,

I hope this message finds you well! I wanted to reach out regarding your request. I have combined everything for your order tomorrow into SO185606. 

Going forward, please contact us by phone or email before creating multiple orders. The reason we do not combine orders is that, systematically, it can cause issues. It makes it difficult to manage produce on orders and can lead to losing items due to backorders.

Additionally, please be aware that with the new produce limits we are introducing, partners will need to wait 30 minutes after placing an order to edit it. Moreover, there will be another 30-minute waiting period after making any edits before further changes can be made.

We appreciate your patience as we navigate this change.

Thank you!

Best,

Comment.3:
10/09/2024 12:15;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good afternoon

Thank you for contacting us about food item dates and quality issues. We want to ensure that all the food leaving our warehouse is safe for consumption and properly dated for your knowledge. Some of the items you mentioned are *donated products*. As we increase the donated products on our menu, I want to make sure that all partners are aware that Capital Area Food Bank accepts donations with items past their best by and sell by dates.

The best by date is an indicator of the quality of a product but is not a safety date. The sell by date is for inventory management and tells the store for how long to display the product for sale. The product can still be consumed after this date. It's important to note that many of our donated products will be past these dates, but they are not expired and are still safe for consumption.

We have food coding guides that partners can print and reference during distributions. When available, they can be ordered in English and Spanish from our Nutrition Education Department. The dates on some products may cause concerns for partners and their clients, but we urge you all to differentiate between the different dates on products, use the food coding guide as a reference, and also use your best judgment as well as your food safety knowledge. If you have a product that is not of the right consistency, has an odor, or you believe to be not okay, please let us know and discard the item immediately. As we increase our donations, we may encounter some challenges, but please work with us and continue to provide us with feedback.

Additionally, if you ever have an issue with fresh produce, please include photos of the items so that we can forward them to our Operations and Food Resourcing Departments for their knowledge.

We appreciate your partnership with us in this.

For Nutrition Materials including the Food Coding Guide, please email: [education@capitalareafoodbank.org|mailto:education@capitalareafoodbank.org]

[^Food Coding Guidance.pdf]

"D"

Description: Dear partner support coordinator we at FBC KenGar have grant allocations from 3 different grants 2 of the expires in 30 days and the third expires in June When we order food the funds are taken out of the grant that expires later Is there any way that you could take the money from the accounts that expire first It would be greatly appreciated Thanks FBC coordinator
Comment:
04/26/2024 03:49;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good afternoon,

Thank you for contacting our Customer Service. I'd be happy to assist you with your query.

Our system applies grants on a per-line-item basis, meaning only one grant can be applied to each line item. In your past couple of orders, you have had line items with high numbers ranging from $250 to $2,653.30. Â The system is going to use the grant that has enough available funds which might not be the one with the closest expiration date. Please see below: 

You have three grants:

* 1-G $3,000 (Expires 1^st^)
** SO136067 used $890.00
** SO122558 used $812.60
*** Remaining Balance: $514.98
* 1-H $2,378 (Expires 2^nd^)
** SO146902 used $762.58
** SO142621 used $1,498.84
*** Remaining Balance: $116.58
* 1-I $6,564 (Expires 3^rd^)
** *SO157471 (your most recent order)* _was placed and totaled in $854.20, the only grant that could cover the entirety of this line item for the chicken was your 1-I grant. If the system pulled from either of your other two grants, it would not cover the total cost of the chicken._

I hope this clarifies the situation. If you have any more questions, please feel free to ask.

Best regards,

"D"

Description: Ms Jackson Gaithersburg HELP is an allvolunteer organization that has been serving the needy in our local community for 56 years and we are dedicated to supporting as many families with food each month as we can In fact last month HELP served 500 families at our pantry in the Festival Shopping Center We have only a couple of volunteer drivers who can deliver food and we must reserve that service for those individuals who live alone or have a partner who also cant drive to the pantry You had asked for us to deliver food to a family of 9 people As you must know from your previous food pickups which total 30 since 2018 we pack according to family size so a family of 9 would receive at least 8 heavy bags of groceries We simply cant ask a volunteer all of whom tend to be over 60 years of age to pick up and deliver many bags of groceries and that would not be appropriate when there are ablebodied family members in residence As an allvolunteer organization we strive to serve as many families as possible but we can sustain our operation only if almost all of our families pick up at the pantry If a client needs to come to the pantry via bus we offer bus tokens so that transportation to and from the pantry is free It is not an insult to let someone know that we have limited capabilities for food delivery Its just a fact And we would not ask to see proof of disability We explain our limited delivery ability to any client who asks about delivery Also our coordinators always provide information about how to get food from Manna andor the Gaithersburg Hope Center Clients can get food from us while also getting food from those other organizations In that way we hope clients find they have more money to apply toward rent or utility bills Our yearly client survey results validate that outcome and that our volunteers treat clients with dignity and promptness We could serve your family very quickly with food if someone could drive to the pantry or come via bus Margo On Thu Nov 14 2024 at 211PM Yvette Jackson via Info wrote Dear Capital Area Food Bank Support Team My name is Yvette Jackson and I am writing to report an issue I experienced with food assistance delivery from Gaithersburg HELP On Monday at 936 am I called to apply for food assistance delivery but my request was refused based on the number of people in my household and our ages Specifically this refusal has caused significant inconveniences and insult to my family and me as we urgently need food assistance Insulting my family by indicating shows a lack of empathy and compassion After making a complaint I received a response at 1254 pm today indicating that the refusal and statement were correct due to the volunteer nature of the service and their inability to deliver help to a large household I was directed to seek assistance from other sources such as Manna Food I believe there might be a misunderstanding or miscommunication regarding our eligibility for this service Attached to this email you will find documentation of my disability for your review Please note the MetroAccess document on line 16 which indicates that my disability prevents me from independently using the accessible Metrobus and Metrorail system for all trips I am unable to walk due to L spine disease with a risk of falls panic attacks anxiety and nontolerance to crowds At this point I feel my disability age and household circumstances are severely limiting my access to essential help I would appreciate your assistance in reviewing this matter and providing any necessary support to ensure that my household can receive the food assistance we need as it appears Gaithersburg Help is not completely meeting the needs of the community I value your prompt attention to this issue and look forward to your response

 "When there are able-bodied family members in residence" is an assumption.{color:#26282a}{color}{adf}{"type":"expand","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thanks,"},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"Ms. Yvette L. Comment.2:
11/14/2024 06:05;qm:65d20c5a-0c84-458e-8ce1-adb90d07460f:da2df791-e8e0-4621-837a-46b2d01f5737;Not really. We know the ages of your household members, and you told our coordinator that some if them work in DC. Nonetheless, we could not deliver food for 9 people. Somehow, your family managed to pick up food at the pantry many times. 

Margo{adf}{"type":"expand","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Margo Goldman "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"Executive Director, Gaithersburg HELP  "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"margo.goldman@gaithersburghelp.org","marks":[{"type":"link","attrs":{"href":"mailto:margo.goldman@gaithersburghelp.org"}}]}]}],"attrs":{"title":"Signature"}}{adf}
Comment.4:
11/14/2024 06:23;qm:65d20c5a-0c84-458e-8ce1-adb90d07460f:58d15b4c-6d52-447e-947b-3e7da2bb2a2a;We were able to pick up when I had a vehicle but there have been times when delivery was accommodated before having transportation, around 2018.

Just so you are aware, working doesn't automatically mean someone is able-bodied. "Able-bodied" typically refers to a person who has no physical disabilities and can perform tasks without any limitations caused by a disability. Many people with disabilities or health conditions can still work, often with the help of accommodations or support.

So, just because someone has a job, it doesn't necessarily mean they don't have a disability. It's important to look at each person's unique situation and disabilities which you have indicated is not asked. 

Thank you for your response. This ends our conversation, however, I have added other agencies in this correspondence just so they are aware.


Best regards,{color:#26282a}{color}{adf}{"type":"expand","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Ms. Yvette L. JacksonLadean_29@yahoo.com","marks":[{"type":"textColor","attrs":{"color":"#172b4d"}},{"type":"link","attrs":{"href":""}}]}]}],"attrs":{"title":"Signature"}}{adf}

Description: Will you sell turkeys this year for Thanksgiving
Comment:
11/14/2024 12:40;712020:38c82492-84fe-40dc-8901-61d65a68f6d3;Thank you for inquiring about the availability of turkeys. With Thanksgiving and the holiday season approaching, we understand the demand for turkeys from our clients and partners. We have two trucks scheduled that arrived in early October with purchased turkeys available on a first-come, first-served basis. Please note that these turkeys will not be free and will have associated costs.

Donated turkeys are traditionally received closer to Thanksgiving. If our Food Resource Team is able to procure additional turkeys, they will also be available for purchase on a first-come, first-served basis.

*Customer Service cannot reserve or allocate turkeys for any partner.* If you are looking for alternative sources of turkey offerings or region-specific turkey donations, we recommend reaching out to your Regional Team.

It's important to note that Customer Service will *not* be involved in the allocation of turkeys. All turkeys, unless already pre-planned for, will be available on a first-come, first-served basis through PartnerLink.

We appreciate your understanding and cooperation. 

CiArra

Comment.2:
06/17/2024 12:07;712020:b15fa988-bc60-49b4-aa6f-e30b7a3629c1;Good afternoon,

Thank you for contacting customer support. I am looking into the dates for your previous orders to confirm that they are safe to eat. 

As a reference, feel free to use our Food Coding Guide (attached)  as a resource when navigating different dates. 

I will follow up with you as soon as I get updates regarding the products you asked about. 
[^Date Coding Guide.pdf]

Charity
Comment.3:
06/26/2024 04:51;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Hi Andrea,

I hope you are doing well. I wanted to talk to you about the ticket you submitted. I apologize for the delay. One of my team members brought up your concerns regarding some items you received from us. After discussing your concerns about the salad dressing with my management and the Food Sourcing Team responsible for all the food that comes into the Food Bank, here are some points I wanted to share with you.

Regarding the salad dressing, our Food Resourcing Team does not have a specific recommendation for shelf-stable milk or salad dressing in our Food Coding Guide. We suggest following the USDA's recommendation regarding this product specifically and apologize for not being able to provide further insight. Partners and clients should use their eyes, noses, and, taste buds to determine if a food is spoiled and therefore unsafe to eat. Of course, if a product is showing any signs of spoilage such as rot, mold, foul odor, etc., we will accept a return. I have brought this issue to management's attention, and I agree that our Food Coding Guide needs improvement. I will raise this with our leadership for further review.

In response to your second point, I acknowledge the importance of best-by dates for our partners and their clients. However, our team faces challenges in obtaining these dates for donated products. One challenge arises during packing events when volunteers check and pack donated items into cases labeled as assorted on the menu. These assorted cases contain items from various donors and are packed without specific best-by date information for each individual product. Another challenge occurs when we receive donated products in different case lots-with different dates, making it difficult to provide accurate best-by dates to our partners. We don't know what case lot your order is going to be pulled from until its pulled the day before or two before its delivered or picked up. Although we practice FIFO (first in, first out) inventory management, the dynamic nature of our inventory makes it challenging to predict best-by dates with certainty. As our inventory of donated products increases, we are committed to improving our processes to provide partners with the information they need to make informed decisions. We are continuously seeking ways to improve our processes, and I encourage partners to participate in the upcoming  Partner meetings in July to address any questions or recommendations regarding product dates.

Thank you for bringing these concerns to our attention.

Warm regards,

"D"

Description: Good morning Last week I had sent a message asking about a handbook on rules and regulations available online I was told that it is still in progress We are wondering what are CAFB guidelines regarding volunteers and CAFB food Do they need to sign up to receive food or is this left up to the individual partners to set these guidelines Thank you Have a blessed week Andrea

Comment:
10/28/2024 12:12;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good afternoon, Andrea,

Thank you for your question. Could you please clarify a bit more about what you are asking? Are you referring to your volunteers at your site? Is your question what regulations are  in place regarding your volunteers obtaining food from your distributions that include food from CAFB?

Iâ€™m happy to help; I just need some clarification.

Best,  
"D"
Comment.2:
10/28/2024 01:30;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Hi Andrea, 

I spoke to the Regional Coordinators and below is the itnel that they had to share about this topic: 

_Partners cannot require clients to volunteer in exchange for food. This policy must be clearly communicated between both parties (partner site and volunteer). However, if a volunteer needs food and wishes to continue volunteering, partners have the option to take them on as clients as well. Since you are using Service Insights, the partners will need to create a client profile for the volunteer in the same manner as they do for all clients._ 

_Volunteers have the same access to food as clients. Therefore, if the partner has zip code or income restrictions, the volunteer must meet the same qualifications as clients do._

Let me know if you need any further questions! 

"D"

Description: Our hours of operation are every second Tuesday of the month from 12 Noon 200 PM
Comment:
09/30/2024 04:08;712020:38c82492-84fe-40dc-8901-61d65a68f6d3;Good afternoon,

Thank you for reaching out. We will not be hosting another training session, but there are tools available to assist you. You can find a guide in PDF format called "Hours of Operations" under the Partner Resource Tab on PartnerLink. This document provides instructions on how to update your hours of operation. 

Once you are logged into PartnerLink, click on your agency name to access your Account Overview. Under Additional Information, you will find a button labeled "Hours of Operations." Click on it to view the hours currently listed for your agency. If the hours are correct, click "verify" to confirm. If the hours are not correct, please make the necessary changes by clicking â€œeditâ€, submit them, and once approved by your Regional Coordinator, the updated hours will be officially updated.



Screenshots have been included to provide visual guidance (They are examples not for your agency). 

If you still need assistance please attend one of our online Office Hours every Wednesday from 10am-10am: [https://capitalareafoodbank.zoom.us/zbook/partner-support/customer-relations-office-hours|https://capitalareafoodbank.zoom.us/zbook/partner-support/customer-relations-office-hours|smart-link] 

Thank you,

CiArra

Description: Hi Partner Support We were told that cases of fresh vegetables would be available some time ago They are never available when were placing our orders So does that mean they are really never going to be available anymore for small sites with no dock availabilty We have not been able to pick up fresh vegetables since Covid began and inhouse shopping was discontinued Your positive response would be appreciated MaryAnn Tolbert
Comment:
01/06/2025 08:14;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good afternoon,

Thank you for reaching out to Customer Relations. I appreciate your inquiry. We offer a variety of fruits and vegetables on our menu throughout the week, but the selection can vary depending on seasonal availability. During the winter months, for example, we typically have fewer options compared to the summer when a wider variety of produce is available. 

In recent weeks, the fruits and vegetables available have primarily included potatoes, apples, and carrots. Due to producelimitations placed on agencies, our Food Resources Team is working to bring in more produce items in case lot instead of large bins and full pallets, but this remains an ongoing challenge. Currently, all produce items must be ordered through PartnerLink, as there are no plans to reopen the agency mart for direct pickups.

I have two suggestions to enhance your experience in this situation. First, you can place orders up to 10 days in advance of your scheduled pickup and delivery date. I recommend placing your order as soon as the calendar opens and frequently checking PartnerLink for available produce. You can edit and add to your order until it locks for fulfillment, which is three business days prior to the shipment date. This flexibility allows you to include any additional items you may find during that 10-day window.

Another option is to explore our TEFAP program, a government-subsidized initiative through which participating partners can access additional items to supplement their regular orders. Please note that this program has specific requirements and is managed by the TEFAP team. For more information, you can reach out to Zaynab, the DC TEFAP coordinator: [zkadhem@capitalareafoodbank.org|mailto:zkadhem@capitalareafoodbank.org]

Thank you!

Best regards,  
"D"

Partner Link 2.0 â€“ Password Reset
â€Š
The NEW Partner Link is now available! To gain access to the new site, you must first reset your password. Below are the steps to reset your password.
â€Š

# Go to the Partner Link log in page: [https://order.capitalareafoodbank.org/|https://order.capitalareafoodbank.org/]
# On the log in page, click on the link Forgot Password 
# On the next screen, enter in your email address. IMPORTANT: This must be the same email address that you use to log into the old Partner Link. 
# Within a few minutes, you will receive an email at the email address you typed in. NOTE: If you do not receive the email, please check your Spam and/or Trash folders.
# From the email, click on the Change Password button: 
# This will direct you to a page where you will set your new password 
# Type in your new password and then confirm the same password. Click on the Change Password button. If you get this error, then you didnâ€™t type the passwords exactly the same (remember, passwords are case-sensitive) 
# If both passwords match, after you click Change Password, you will be redirected back to the Log In page.
# Input your email address and your NEW password to gain access to the new Partner Link 2.0 site
â€Š
If you have any issues in this process, please contact [partnersupport@capitalareafoodbank.org|mailto:partnersupport@capitalareafoodbank.org]



However, if there are no more delivery slots available for April 7th, you will still not be able to place an order for that day. You could place an order for pickup that day if there are pickup appointments available. That order would have to be placed by noon tomorrow. 

Best,

Comment.2:
04/29/2024 11:18;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good morning,

I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to inform you that you can only apply one grant for a single line item. The system was trying to use the last of your 1-H Grant to cover the line for your peaches (#300387), but your 1-H Grant only had $316.14 left on it, which left a balance of *$505.46* and the same with the line with your macaroni and cheese (#300015), the system is trying to use the last of what was on your 1-G which was $141.07 but the line item had a total of $385.60 leaving a balance of *$244.53*. 

 However, if you would like to use your other grant, Grant 1-I, which has a larger balance and can cover the entire line item costs we can arrange that for you so that you won't have any remaining balance to pay for this sales order.

Please let me know which grant you would like to use, and I will put in a ticket with my IT team to make the necessary changes.

Thank you,

Daniele
Comment.4: 04/29/2024 08:49;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;No problem at all, thank you! If you have any questions please let us know.

* 1 - 700759 Produce Pallet - 3 WAY - Onions, Potatoes, Apples	
* 1 - 822675 Apples, Local MD- 175 x 3# bags in BINS (LFPA)
* 1 - 822676 Apples, Local MD 725# BIN - (LFPA)

* 1 - 700661 Produce, 4-way 50# Mixed PALLET 40 
* 1 - 700566 Produce, 3-way Mixed PALLET 40 Donated NO CARROTS	

Please respond to this email with your selections of which produce items you would like us to remove. Kindly note that if we do not receive your response within 24 hours, our Customer Relations team will make adjustments to your order on your behalf.

Thank you for your attention to this matter!

Best regards,  
Customer Relations

Description: Good morning My agency is limited to 1200 pounds of produce per month We are doing our distribution twice a month and for the month of December I noticed that much of the produce was by pallet even the mixed produce Are you considering making those into smaller bins for those who are limited to less than 2000 lbs
Custom field (Request Category): Partner Produce Limit -> Question or Concern
Comment:
12/19/2024 03:07;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good afternoon, Marie,

I hope you are doing well. Thank you for your question. Yes, our Food Resources team, which is responsible for procuring food, including produce items at the Food Bank, was very much involved in the conversation and collaboration regarding the produce limits. One of their initiatives is to start procuring cases for our smaller agencies that have produce limits under 2,000 lbs.

I also want to remind you that if you see a pallet of, for example, 2,000 lbs, the system will allow you to order over your limit. Customer Service will then reach out to you to discuss your options. If that is the only item available at that time and no cases are offered, we will permit the overage as long as it is not excessive.

Best,
"D"

Comment.1:
12/12/2024 02:30;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Subject: Request for Forwarding Ticket

Good afternoon, Alanna,

I'm having trouble with the system; it will not allow me to forward this ticket to Jessica or respond directly to the partner. Could you please forward the response below on my behalf? Thank you!

----

Good afternoon,

Thank you for reaching out to Customer Service. You had a great question about our recall process. 

For our DDP programs (mobile and community markets), the recall outreach process differs from that of the partnership teams. When a recall is identified, our Food Resources, Analytics, and Operations Teams collaborate with our programs and my team (Customer Relations) to contact the partners who ordered the affected items. It is then the partners' responsibility to reach out to their clients.

For DDP, the process is slightly different. I recommend contacting Jessica Arias, one of our managers on the DDP team, to learn more about how they notify their sites and assist those sites in informing their respective clients. 

Here is her contact information:

Jessica Arias  
[jarias@capitalareafoodbank.org|mailto:jarias@capitalareafoodbank.org]  

Best regards,  
"D"

Comment.12:
10/01/2024 08:08;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good afternoon,

Thank you for your message to our team and for your patience while we look into this matter.

I apologize for the issues with your two orders. Regarding the Produce Boxes, we have contacted your Regional Coordinators, Grace and Augusta, and they will communicate with Coastalâ€™s Customer Service Team to address the problem with your produce boxes that were not distributable. Augusta has offered to follow up with them and relay any next steps back to you.

As for the peanut butter, thank you for providing photos. We appreciate it. The peanut butter in your order, as well as many of our other donated items, have passed their "best by" date. This date indicates when the product will be at its best flavor or quality and is not a safety date. Itâ€™s a quality date that encourages consumers to eat food while it is in its prime state. Food that is past this date is not bad and should not be thrown away. We provide a food coding guide to our partners that explains these dates further. We want to reassure you that the peanut butter is not expired and will not cause any harm to consumers. We offer the Food Coding Guides as a resource and we have them printed and available to order for partners as well to pass out at distributions. 

[^Food Coding Guidance.pdf]

Thank you,

"D"

Description: Item 300066 Canned Tomatoes total amount 81700 Only 7359 has been deducted from grants allocated Please adjust the balance of 74341 using the grant still available Not sure why it was not deducted There is a balance of 1801 in Grant FY24 Region MOCO 1H and another balance of 638086 on Grant FY24 Region MOCO 1I Thank you
Comment:
04/25/2024 04:57;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good afternoon,

Thank you for contacting our Customer Service. I'd be happy to assist you with your query.

Our system applies grants on a per-line-item basis, which means that only one grant can be applied to each line item. In the case of your order, the line item is $817.00, and the system initially used the last of your FY24 MD Region Moco 1-G grant, which was $75.59. 

However, as per your request, I have contacted our IT department to apply your FY24 MD Region MOCO 1-I grant to that line item since it is the only grant you have that can cover the entire amount.

Please note that moving forward, the $75.59 remaining on your 1-G grant and the $18.01 left on your 1-H grant may not cover the entire line item cost. If this happens, it is because our system applies the grants on a per-line-item basis. If you have a line item that costs less than these amounts in future orders, then you will have no remaining balance.

I hope this clarifies the situation. If you have any more questions, please feel free to ask.

Best regards,

"D"

However, if you would like to use your other grant, Grant 1-I or Grant 1-H, which have a larger balances and can cover the entire line item cost we can arrange that for you so that you won't have any remaining balance to pay for this sales order.

Thank you,

03/14/2023 03:55;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Hi Marian, 

I am so sorry for the delay. Feeding America got back to our food resourcing team about the biscuits. Please see below: 

*_Rolled Biscuits: Yield 6-8 biscuits. 1 pkg Jack & the Beanstalk Buttermilk Biscuit Mix, 1/2 cup water, preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Blend biscuit mix and water to a soft dough. Turn dough onto lightly floured surface, knead several times. Pat or roll dough 1/2 inch thick. Cut with 2 inch floured cutter and place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake about 10 minutes. Drop Biscuits: Follow recipe above except do not knead. Drop by spoonful onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake 10-12 minutes._*

*_Do not eat raw batter, dough or mix. Corn Muffins: Yield 6 - 8 muffins depending on size. 1 pkg. Jack & the Beanstalk Cornbread Mix and Corn muffin mix. 1 egg. 1/3 cup milk. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Grease muffin pan or use paper baking cups. Blend ingredients. Batter will be slightly lumpy. (for maximum crown on muffins let batter rest for 3 or 4 minutes, stir lightly before filling cups.) Fill muffin cups 2/3 full. Bake 15 - 20 minutes or until golden brown._*

Â Thank you for your patience. 

DH

Comment:
04/17/2023 08:43;6064f10d61000300682aab1d;Hi Marian, 

Unfortunately, our system does not have the capability to transfer an item between orders. You can only remove the item from one order and then add that item to the other order but of course there is no guarantee that someone else might not take that available inventory. 

Additionally, partners do not have the capability to edit the date of their order. You can send a request to partner support for your order date be to be updated, but we can only do so if there are available appointments and the new order date is more than 3 days in advance of the ship date. 

Hope this information helps! 

Best, 

Riley

Comment.1:
07/03/2024 11:10;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good morning,

Thank you for your questions about the limited items on the menu. While I don't have a general answer, there are several factors at play. Firstly, at certain times of the year, we have constraints on our receiving calendar, which leads to fewer inventory trucks due to scheduling conflicts. Currently, we are facing this situation as we were closed for Juneteenth, went through our bi-annual inventory last week, and will also be closed for the July 4th observance next week. Additionally, as we prepare for our move back to home building in the Virginia region, there may be a slight shift in the amount of products as we transition inventory from one location to another. This means we have been and will continue to receive fewer trucks than usual and are trying to schedule loads that fit within this restricted schedule.

Moreover, while donations vary, we are actively working to increase the amount of donated food we receive and make it available through our Partner Direct Program and the menu. This issue will be discussed in an upcoming in-person partner meeting in July, giving partners the opportunity to hear from our leadership and our Food Resourcing Team, who are responsible for sourcing all the food on the menu, both donated and purchased.

Let me know if you have any further questions or concerns.

Thanks,

"D"

11/26/2024 08:14;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good morning,

Thank you for reaching out to us about this! You did not do anything wrong. An "order issue" means that we ordered this product from a farmer or vendor, and something went wrong with our order. For example, they may have been scheduled to deliver it one week but informed us they couldn't come until the following week, or they told us we were supposed to receive 10 cases but only delivered 6.

Rest assured, this is not your fault!

Best,

The hours listed are not the general hours of operation for your office or establishment, but instead indicate the days and hours when you distribute food. Your agency is listed as distributing food on Thursdays from 3pm to 5pm. You will be asked to confirm this information approximately once every quarter (or every 3 months). We will require you to log in and confirm that you are distributing food at the same time. To do so, please log into your account, go to the "hours of operation" tab, and click on 'verify' if the information is correct and unchanged. You can then proceed with your shopping. Description: Dear Partner Support Last Friday 21425 sale order SO194429 was delivered to our location It included 3 bins of cereal item 100862 At first sight we noticed rodent droppings on top of cereal boxes in one of those bins That bin was not accepted and the delivery driver loaded it back up inside his truck The other two bins were b rought upstairs to our storage room To our surprise a few minutes later we saw a mouse coming out of one bin and returning inside that bin We had to act quickly since other food items were stored inside this room We immediately wrapped both bins loaded them inside our vehicle and drove to two landfill sites to dispatch the two open bins with donated assorted cereal Upon dispatching them our staff saw two mice This confirmed our fear that more than one mouse had entered inside our building and our storage room through the open bin cereals that we ordered Of course the issue was not over and the following Monday 21725 we caught another mouse We will continue to closely monitor our storage room and other areas to be certain that the problem has been eradicated Attached are pictures of what was left behind after we removed the two bins out of the storage room This experience was very disturbing and a solution needs to be implemented quickly This put us behind schedule by four days due to the intervention that we put in place We also had to throw away our products that the mice had contaminated CAFB has been such a great partner to us and we are forever grateful for the all in support that you have been providing us to allow us to help our underserved communities That is why we are sharing this information and our experience to you so this can be further looked at and hopefully avoided We are in this together to strengthen food security so we know this kind of issue will be attended to and taken seriously by both parties We look forward to your feedback or resolution around this matter Thank you and Best regards Anna Beavan and Jeannette Mendy Jeannette Mendy

Comment.1:
02/21/2025 09:48;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good morning Jeanette,

I hope youâ€™re doing well today. I was very concerned to hear about the issues youâ€™ve encountered with mice droppings and the presence of mice near the food you received from us. Please know that I am genuinely sorry for this distressing experience, and I want to extend my heartfelt apologies on behalf of Capital Area Food Bank and our Customer Service and Operations Team.

This morning, I forwarded the information you provided in your ticket, along with your photos, to our Director of Operations. She is taking this matter very seriously and has scheduled a meeting with her team to ensure we find a prompt and effective resolution. They will be focusing on maintaining cleanliness and ensuring rodent protection in our facilities, as well as inspecting our warehouse products, particularly those in question, to ensure they are removed if necessary.

I want to support you through this situation. Could you please let me know which specific products you needed to be disposed of due to the potential rodent issue, aside from the bins of cereal? I understand how disruptive this can be to your food distribution efforts, and I truly empathize with the challenges it presents in providing safe and healthy food to the community you serve.

I will also reach out to my supervisor to discuss possible compensation for the inconvenience caused by this situation, as we value your partnership and want to make things right.

Thank you for your understanding, and once again, Iâ€™m truly sorry for the trouble this has caused. We are committed to resolving this matter as quickly as possible.

Best wishes,  
"D"

 I hope this message finds you well. I wanted to reach out personally to follow up on the recent incident and to express my sincere apologies for any disruption it may have caused you.  I have escalated this matter to our Operations Director, and I want you to know that we have a new leader in Operations who is dedicated to ensuring we serve our partners with the utmost care and precision. She is committed to making improvements and has assured me that we are taking significant steps to prevent such situations from occurring in the future.   Some of the measures weâ€™re implementing include:  1. Continuing our routine pest control efforts. 2. Collaborating with our pest control company, which visited our facility on Monday to conduct additional work beyond our normal maintenance. 3. Strengthening our inspection processes to ensure that all pullers, drivers, and inspectors thoroughly check every order once it's staged. 4. Focusing on the quality of products going out to our partners. 5. Preparing for the warmer months ahead to maintain a rodent-free and clean environment for the food we deliver.  I truly empathize with the impact this situation may have had on your operations, and I want to assure you that we are committed to providing a better service moving forward. Please know that we value your partnership and appreciate your understanding during this time.  As a gesture of goodwill, we would like to waive the delivery fees for both your recent order and your upcoming order on March 3rd.  If you have any questions or concerns, please donâ€™t hesitate to reach out. Your feedback is important to us, and weâ€™re here to help.  Thank you for your understanding.  

Warm regards,

 "D"

Comment.2: 07/05/2023 11:11;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;*The chicken is frozen before its expiration date.* Foods stored in the freezer remain safe almost indefinitely, and even if they are not stored as low as 0 Â° F or below, they will still last much longer than the suggested times. This document provides instructions on how to update your hours of operation.[^Updating Hours of Operations (Partner Facing Document).pdf] 

Once you are logged into PartnerLink, click on your agency name to access your Account Overview. Under Additional Information, you will find a button labeled "Hours of Operations." Click on it to view the hours currently listed for your agency. If the hours are correct, click "verify" to confirm. Comment: 09/25/2024 06:40;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Thank you for your inquiry on our Hours of Operations Feature on PartnerLink. We encouraged all partners to attend one of the four trainings that we hosted between August and September to ensure that everyone was well-equipped to utilize this feature effectively. This feature is crucial for maintaining accurate information about your agency's operating hours, which in turn updates our [Get Help Map|https://www.capitalareafoodbank.org/find-food-assistance/] on the website. The Get Help Map is a tool that clients use to locate nearby CAFB Partners, so it's essential to have the correct hours displayed. If you were unable to attend the trainings, don't worry. There are alternative options available, such as accessing the resource on PartnerLink under the Partner Resources tab, or signing up for [Customer Relations Office Hours|https://capitalareafoodbank.zoom.us/zbook/partner-support/customer-relations-office-hours] held every Wednesday from 10am-11am. Please note that due to the nature of the training, there are no recordings or slides available, as it involved a live demo and Q&A session. While partners are not being reprimanded for not attending a training, it's important to highlight that starting *October 1st*, partners who have not updated or confirmed their hours will see a banner prompting them to do so before placing an order. You will need to take this action to proceed with making an order. If your hours have not changed, simply verify them by accessing the Agency Overview section after clicking your agency name on PartnerLink. If changes are necessary, please update them accordingly. For further assistance, please contact us at [partnersupport@capitalareafoodbank.org|mailto:partnersupport@capitalareafoodbank.org].

Description: Hi I am expecting a delivery on Monday January 6th and there is snow in the forecast I was hoping to review your inclement weather policies and the link sends me to 2024 Holidayspdf Would you please let me know what will happen if it snows and what do I need to do Thank you and Happy New Year Luanne Ailes Messiah UMC phone number
Comment:
01/01/2025 11:22;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good morning, Luanne,

Happy New Year! I hope you had a great holiday. I have attached our Inclement Weather Policy below.

[^Inclement Weather Policy.pdf]

In the event that it snows, we will wait for information from our leadership, including the Head of Operations, to determine if we will have a formal delay or closure - we do not follow the governmentâ€™s decisions regarding weather. For example, if we announce a 2-hour delay, all delivery and pickup windows will be pushed back accordingly. This means that if you had an 8 AM - 10 AM delivery, it will now be scheduled for 10 AM - 12 PM.

If we face a complete closure due to the weather, there will be no deliveries or pickups. On such days, the Customer Relations team will be available to reschedule deliveries and reach out to all partners regarding their orders.

Additionally, please keep in mind that depending on the amount of snow, there may be impacts on the days following the snowfall. If we do have a closure, we will do our best to accommodate our partners' schedules while ensuring that orders are not affected the following day.

I hope this helps! Please let me know if you need any further information.

Best,  
"D"

01/17/2025 12:15;712020:b15fa988-bc60-49b4-aa6f-e30b7a3629c1;Good morning,

I am happy to provide further insight. The pallet you ordered will not be removed from your order and will be delivered on the 21st. 

However, this pallet has exceeded your agencyâ€™s produce limit of *250lbs*. At this time, due to the transition of implementing produce limits, we are not removing any produce from orders even if it exceeds their limit to allow partners to adjust. Once partners are more familiar of this process, we will begin adjusting orders, in communication with you, to have your orders align closer to your monthly allotted poundage. 

You are able to continue submitting orders as your agency allows, but for the rest of this or any month, you will no longer be eligible to order more produce once the limit has been met or exceeded.

Please reach out to your Regional Team should you feel like an adjustment would be most beneficial for your agency.

Hope this helps!
Charity

Comment.3:
07/03/2024 10:46;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good morning Julia,

I hope you are doing well. Unfortunately, after researching our internal resources, I was unable to find guidance on snack-type items. We primarily use the Food Coding Guide to help partners navigate such questions. When there are gaps, we recommend relying on research and information available online, particularly the USDA website. Furthermore, we advise partners and clients to use their senses (sight, smell, and taste) to determine if a food is spoiled and unsafe to eat.[Food Product Dating | Food Safety and Inspection Service (usda.gov)|https://www.fsis.usda.gov/food-safety/safe-food-handling-and-preparation/food-safety-basics/food-product-dating]

[Shelf-Stable Food Safety | Food Safety and Inspection Service (usda.gov)|https://www.fsis.usda.gov/food-safety/safe-food-handling-and-preparation/food-safety-basics/shelf-stable-food]

I have also noted that for our development, I will raise this issue to our leadership. I believe that having a more comprehensive tool would be incredibly useful for many partners.

"D"

Description: Good Morning The delivery was made today by Mr Ebenezer However he refused to pick up the empty pallets Hes the first driver who has not done this on the day of delivery Could you please send someone to pick them up Our space is very limited and we dont have room for the empty pallets of last week I also made a mistake when signing the order and he was very upset Thank you Matilde Alvarado Mother of Light Center
Comment:
10/01/2024 10:13;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good morning Mitilde,

I hope you are doing well. Thank you for sharing your feedback with us; it is very valuable. I will follow up with the Transportation Leadership Team to address the way the drivers communicate with partners about this issue.

To provide some context, there are two main reasons why drivers may not take pallets when dropping off food during a delivery. Firstly, they may have food for an immediate order or need to pick up food from another site for the warehouse, which means they cannot have food and pallets on the truck at the same time due to food safety (Pallets are often leftoutside- on the ground, possibly in the rain, and are often dirty) and consideration for our partners. Secondly, our drivers may be on tight schedules and do not have the time for a pallet pickup due to their busy delivery schedules, especially during the busy season.

There is no reason why a driver could not explain this to you at the time, and I will ensure that this information is communicated to them. I apologize for your experience. 

Thank you,

"D"
Comment.1: 10/01/2024 10:21;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;I spoke with the Transportation Supervisor, and she mentioned that she received feedback about the pallets not being stacked properly and having trash around them. She has scheduled a pallet pickup for tomorrow. Please make sure that the pallets are stacked together to allow the equipment to pick them up easily, there is no debris around them, and they are placed on concrete, not on grass. Thank you!

account for ordering closed Thank you Regards Matilde Alvarado Mother of Light Center 703 508 5289 On Mon Jul 29 2024 at 406PM partner Support wrote Good morning partners We are thrilled to announce that on August 5th we will be launching a new feature on PartnerLink This feature will enable partners to update their Hours of Operations for your distributions This new feature is very exciting because it means that you will be able to update your records whenever necessary This ensures that we have the most uptodate information in our internal systems and for clients to utilize As a reminder once approved the information we gather from your updates will be linked to the information provided in our online tool that clients can use to locate food assistance To ensure that all partners understand how to utilize this function we will host four training sessions two in August and two in September These sessions are designed to demonstrate how to use this feature and also provide an opportunity to talk to our team about PartnerLink and provide feedback Please note that this training is mandatory You can use the links below to register your agency We only require one representative per agency to attend but we welcome and encourage all shoppers who have access to PartnerLink to join We recommend that this person work closely with the food program and has a deep understanding of operations While the training will be recorded and slides will be shared all partners are expected to attend the live training to fulfill the requirements If you have any questions please feel free to contact Customer Relations Please to register Upon selecting a training date and completing the form you will receive the corresponding Zoom link via email We are also excited to announce that the Customer Relations team will be hosting office hours every Wednesday in August and September from 10 am to 11 am starting August 14th If you have any questions or support needs Comment:
10/02/2024 09:09;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good afternoon,

Thank you for reaching out. We will not be hosting another training session, but there are tools available to assist you. You can find a guide in PDF format called "Hours of Operations" under the Partner Resource Tab on PartnerLink. This document provides instructions on how to update your hours of operation. 

Once you are logged into PartnerLink, click on your agency name to access your Account Overview. Under Additional Information, you will find a button labeled "Hours of Operations." Click on it to view the hours currently listed for your agency. If the hours are correct, click "verify" to confirm. If the hours are not correct, please make the necessary changes by clicking â€œeditâ€, submit them, and once approved by your Regional Coordinator, the updated hours will be officially updated.
