Description: Hi team I hope you are doing well Alexis
Comment:
01/03/2025 01:20;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good morning, Alexis,

I hope this message finds you well, and Happy New Year! Thank you for providing this important information; it is definitely something we need to note.

To give you some background, partners have been charged delivery fees for orders that include a mix of TEFAP products and other donated or purchased items for some time. As stated in our SMART Shopping Policy, orders that contain only TEFAP products do not incur a delivery fee. However, orders that mix TEFAP with purchased or donated products do have a delivery fee associated with them.

I do not have the ability to remove delivery fees from all orders, as these fees are automatically added when partners place their orders. I believe we will need to submit an ERP ticket to stop this charge permanently, as it is an automated process. 

To clarify what the ticket would entail: Are we asking for no delivery fees to be applied to any orders containing any TEFAP items for al regions? Additionally, will we need to issue refunds for past orders that were charged delivery fees due to the mix of TEFAP and other products? I anticipate that partners will inquire about previous orders that included these fees as we proceed with this change and it also may be a good idea to plan for a formal communication to TEFAP partners since this is a change in poliy that we have previously stated to them. 

Is there a deadline for when this needs to be implemented? I understand that it should be done as soon as possible, but any changes/refunds to delivery fees are always approved by Austin, who is currently out until January 9th.

Thank you for bringing this matter back to our attention again, hope to resolve this as soon as possible! 

Best,  
"D"
Comment.1: 01/03/2025 05:19;6064f0ca1613f30068073e90;Hey "D", happy new year and thanks for your response! Yes, weâ€™re asking for no delivery fees to be applied to any orders containing any TEFAP items for al regions. But, I donâ€™t think we need to issue refunds or change this immediately. I can flag this to Austin for when she returns and circle back to you. Agreed that weâ€™ll need to send out a communication, and my thought is we can word it as this will be our process going forward.
Comment.2: 01/24/2025 12:33;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Closing this ticket as this issue is currently being handled by Alexis and Austin. If any further steps are taken, the associated teams will be made aware.

Comment.1:
10/24/2024 01:31;712020:e3f1b9a5-afcd-4846-bd16-3cc8c3d8a80c;Dr. Head, 

  

We appreciate the wonderful service you provide to your community and your partnership with CAFB for the last 15 years. Different programs within CAFB have different rules and regulations. TEFAP falls under the rules and regulations of MD DHS, collection of SDI forms is one of the requirements set forth by them not by myself or by CAFB. 

  

I completely understand that the work that you and all your volunteers do is hard and exhausting work. We also understand that not everyone is able to, qualifies for, or feels comfortable completing the SDI form. This is why we do always recommend there be non TEFAP food set aside for those do not qualify or are unable to complete the SDI form. 

  

My goal is not to suspend New Hope and Life Church of God, it is to work with you and each partner to ensure there is compliance with regulations set forth by MD DHS, to work together when other problems arise, and to get to know each partner to the best of my ability so that I can continue to advocate for change at the state level. 

  

Regarding the monthly inventory report for the month of August, like covered in the civil rights training, regardless of whether food was distributed a report must still be submitted. In the case of no distribution, you would just need to put 0 under the household and individuals served, note any inventory you have at the time, sign and submit. 

I can also look at your sales order record and send you the food ordered around that time frame which may help in the completion of the report. 

  

I do want to remind you that I am out of town tomorrow Friday October 24th and Monday, October 28th. Like stated in the previous emails, what needs to be submitted on Wednesday, October 23rd is the signed corrective action plan, a summary of how you will be collecting SDI forms, and submission of the monthly inventory reports that have not yet been submitted. Submission of the reports can be through the links originally sent or if your organization completed the reports previously, they should have been sent an email copy of the report which can then be emailed to me. 

  

I appreciate your patience, understanding and the work you and you organization does for the community. 

  

Best, 

Lucy 

  
  {color:inherit}

Thank you for reaching out. We will not be hosting another training session, but there are tools available to assist you. You can find a guide in PDF format called "Hours of Operations" under the Partner Resource Tab on PartnerLink. This document provides instructions on how to update your hours of operation. 

Once you are logged into PartnerLink, click on your agency name to access your Account Overview. Under Additional Information, you will find a button labeled "Hours of Operations." Click on it to view the hours currently listed for your agency. If the hours are correct, click "verify" to confirm. If the hours are not correct, please make the necessary changes by clicking â€œeditâ€, submit them, and once approved by your Regional Coordinator, the updated hours will be officially updated.

If you still need assistance please attend one of our online Office Hours every Wednesday from 10am-10am: [https://capitalareafoodbank.zoom.us/zbook/partner-support/customer-relations-office-hours|https://capitalareafoodbank.zoom.us/zbook/partner-support/customer-relations-office-hours|smart-link]

Description: Good Morning A few months ago we were contacted about switching our distribution day from Tuesday to a later day in the week and we agreed to move it to Wednesday However weve found that having only one day between our distribution dates has been challenging for our volunteers and has created scheduling conflicts with some of our other pickups Now that the holidays are over wed like to request switching back to our original Tuesday distribution This change would allow us to serve the community more effectively and provide our volunteers with adequate time to recover between distributions We understand the importance of aligning with your delivery schedule and want to remain considerate of your operations However we would greatly appreciate it if this adjustment could be made Please let us know if this is possible Looking forward to hearing from you Best regards Oliver
Comment:
01/28/2025 01:31;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good afternoon, Mr. Oliver,

I hope this message finds you well. Thank you for bringing this to our attention! I have discussed this matter with our leadership and the team involved in this initiative. We appreciate you reopening the discussion.

When we initiated this plan, our goal was to alleviate the burden on our Tuesday schedule due to the number of large deliveries we have on that day. However, we acknowledge the challenges this has caused for your agency, which was not our intended outcome. Letâ€™s work together to find a solution!

One option I wanted to explore with you is whether you would be open to either receiving all your food items on Fridays or accepting deliveries on Mondays instead of Tuesdays. Please let me know your preference, and if neither option works for you, I will take that information back to our department leaders and Operations for further consideration. Our aim is to ensure that we do not burden your distribution or volunteers.

Thank you, Pastor Oliver!

Best regards,  
"D"

Description: Hello We need to pick up about 5 boxes to put in the retails stores that we pick up from Can you let me know if and when we can pick them up
Custom field (Request Category): Agency Administration -> Connection to CAFB Staff
Comment:
12/13/2024 09:10;61536ea272f6970069fc1dbd;Good morning,

Thank you for reaching out to Customer Service. You can pick up donation boxes at the food bank from Monday to Friday, 8 AM to 4 PM, at our warehouse in Washington, DC. If you arrive between 8 AM and 2 PM, please go to the side of the warehouse designated for partner pickups. If you cannot come during those hours, please visit the front of the building where our receptionist is located, and ask for donation boxes from 2 PM to 4 PM.

Please note that our CAFB donation boxes cannot be used for partner donations. For example, you should not place them outside stores for accepting donations to your organization. If you are raising awareness and fundraising for your organization, please refrain from using the CAFB branded boxes.

Thank you,  
"D"

Comment.8:
08/16/2024 01:49;712020:b15fa988-bc60-49b4-aa6f-e30b7a3629c1;Good afternoon,
Â 
We contacted the TEFAP Team and learned that we anticipate receiving a shipment of catfish between October 16th and 31st. Currently, we do not have a waitlist or a reminder system linked to our inventory to alert partners when items are back in stock. This is feedback we have received from partners and have conveyed to our Food Resourcing and Inventory Teams for consideration.
Â 
If you wish to check back during that time and do not see the catfish available, we would be happy to reach out to the TEFAP team to confirm if the shipment is still expected during that period. It seems that in your original order, the product went out of stock. Our inventory is live and operates on a first-come, first-served basis as you know. At times, items may be taken by the time you start the checkout process, resulting in an error message prompting you to update your item quantities based on what's available.
Â 
Additionally, there may be different lots of items with varying expiration dates. Consequently, you may have two lots of the same product arriving at different times, with one having a later expiration date than the other. Depending on the date of your order, the item may have gone out of stock for the specific case lot you selected, even though there are still some available on the menu. This occurs due to the date you chose for your order.
Â 
We acknowledge that our inventory system is complex and are striving to make it more user-friendly and accessible for partners to obtain information from the website.
Â 
Thank you,
Customer Relations

I hope you are doing well. Happy New Year! Since we were closed from December 25th until January 2nd, the last day to place an order for January 6th was December 24th, in accordance with our three business day fulfillment rule. This is why you were unable to make an order for January 6th, and we sincerely apologize for any inconvenience.

Please note that anytime a day is marked in gray on the calendar, it either means that the calendar is full or the day is no longer available due to the deadline for placing an order having passed.

You can schedule a delivery or pickup for Tuesday, January 7th, until the end of the day on January 3rd. There are still some slots available, so please take a look soon to secure an available time.

Thank you,
